title: When to use qemu user mode versus system mode?
content:
This seems to be a pretty basic question but I can't seem to find a good answer. I am currently just following https://w00tsec.blogspot.ca/2013/09/analyzing-and-running-binaries-from.html to learn more about emulating with qemu. Whats the advantages and disadvantages between: 
sudo chroot . ./qemu-mips-static bin/busybox (example)
compared to following the instructions found here: https://people.debian.org/~aurel32/qemu/mips/ 
qemu-system-mips -M malta kernel
Thanks in advance!
